intro: Lomanthus cuatrecasasii, commonly known as the Cuatrecasas's lomatium, is a flowering plant native to the Andes mountains of South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in high-altitude environments, thriving in cool, temperate climates. It features compound leaves with a distinctive, fern-like appearance and produces small, yellow flowers in clusters. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
